subtasks: Choose a pruning method (modified central leader).
Identify and remove branches that are not aligned with the intended structure.
Prune branches to encourage horizontal growth.
Remove competing branches to maintain apical dominance and tree shape.
Maintain spacing between remaining branches for optimal light distribution.
Regularly check and maintain tree height and scaffold positioning.
Document and share pruning techniques for educational purposes.
Guide the central leader to a desired height.
Position scaffold branches for a balanced canopy.
Prune for proper lateral branch development.
Manage upward growth to maintain tree shape and structure.
Trim excess branches to focus energy on selected scaffold branches.
Monitor growth each year to make necessary adjustments.
Identify unnecessary or competing branches for removal.
Prune branches to promote light penetration and air circulation.
Remove crossing branches to prevent damage and reduce disease risk.
Prune suckers and water sprouts as needed.
Attend to any structural issues like leaning branches.
Perform maintenance pruning throughout the tree’s lifetime.
